title: End Game Gold
body:
So we all have those games that last for ages, everyone reaches full build and all you can do with your gold is to upgrade your Scrying Orb {{item:3363}}  or to upgrade your boots. 

I figure it could be a cool idea to have a section of the shop that allows you to buy cosmetic type things with your end game gold, kind of like giving Karthus {{champion:30}}  a new staff or giving Jax {{champion:24}}  a real weapon. As usual there's the fear that trolls with just buy these items from the start and do touchdowns with their new pretty hat or whatever.

Who knows, maybe Riot could stem an actual idea from this.

replies.body:
Or they could just unlock after X amount of time has passed and X amount of gold has been gained/spent. Eg the game has been going for 50 min, the player has earned 15000+ gold (which is about Sorcerer's Shoes, Liandry's, Rabadon's, Rod of Ages, Void Staff, Zhonya's), and spent 15000+ gold.

While cosmetic effects are good, typically if the game has lasted this long players are looking to END the game, which is what the Elixir's are meant to fulfill. I think more gameplay changing items would be a bit better. Maybe the ability to buy one extra item slot? Add an extra upgrade onto some other items in a similar effect to boot enchantments (for example, the ability to buy an enchantment on an item that would reduce the cooldown on the active).

I like the time/money thought, it makes sense. Where I also agree that players do want to end the game at that point, the idea of giving someone something to do with money at the end of the game is all that's behind it. The ability to by an extra item however sort of eliminates the theory behind a limit to how ahead a player can get. If a player gets fed early game often the only thing a team can do is to wait out the late game so everyone can catch up to the fed player.

I do like the enchantments dealeo though, you should totally post a discussion about it

Cheers for the feedback

> As usual there's the fear that trolls with just buy these items from the start and do touchdowns with their new pretty hat or whatever.

You could have it so you can only buy the cosmetic items once you have filled all your item slots. Prevents people just getting them straight up.
And then they buy six longswords? :P
So make it so the items have to be fully upgraded.
well im sure it will bring in players from steam.
